other_tests.findings: Interictal EEG showed slow spike-wave discharges originating from bilateral temporal lobes. Ictal period recordings included focal impaired awareness behavior and focal to bilateral tonic-clonic seizures, with discharges originating from the left temporal-occipital junction and generalizing to the bilateral cerebral hemispheres.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 2 months follow-up, EEG registered occasional epileptiform discharges in bilateral temporal lobes during the interictal period.

other_tests.findings: Registered discharges mainly from heterotopic nodes in the left occipital lobe, temporal-occipital junctions (both left and right), right superior temporal gyrus, and middle temporal gyrus posterior during the interictal period. Ictal onset was registered from the left temporal-occipital junction heterotopic nodes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-coagulation SEEG registered a significant reduction in epileptiform discharges during the interictal period.
